page.title: 20CONSERVATION E.WORLINGTON
page.content: In school we are interested in caring for our environment.In 1981 The Men Of The Trees planted 10 rowan and whitebeam trees to replace dead elm trees.We have set aside part of our grounds for an environmental area. In 1984 we joined the Devon Tree Bank scheme.In the Autumn we dug a 3m square and each child planted a row of seeds that they had collected. The seeds are germinating now.We are also growing some saplings in a 1m square.These were brought from another school by the Tree Bank Co-ordinator. She also gave us some saplings for a hedge.In March we created a pond which we have already started to plant.We hope to encourage many more pond plants and creatures.We are leaving an area of long grass to provide habitat for these creatures.
